page.title: 05RHUALLT POST OFFICE.
page.content: The present owner took over in 1975, the property being a shop/post office. Until approximately 1968 local post was deposited at the post office and was then delivered, with the papers, by the sub-postmaster/owner. Remaining mail for outlying areas (A 20 mile round trip.) was taken by the regular postmen, together with some papers. This latter arrangement continues,to a certain extent,today. There are two collections of mail a day (Mon_Fri) at 11.30am and 4.25pm.Saturday collection is at 11.30am. The stock limit of Â£15 of stamps, Â£50 of postal orders and Â£5 of National Insurance stamps, imposed at the time the present owner took over, has been lifted allowing expansion in trade. Business in Natonal Giro and National Savings has developed well from about 1978.
